favourite.article: I really enjoy this hymn because today I felt so sad and down.. but my Lord Jesus have made my day back :) THANK YOU for HIM :)
PTL for the basic pure word. He is the living bread ... lifting up my spirit
Praise the Lord! You are our living bread.
This song uplifts my spirit! Hallelujah for The Living Bread!!!

Our salvation is just eating this One who gave Himself to us willingly as the living bread. Thank You for this word "anyone"! It's not if we're worthy enough, or when we're without stains. I enjoy a brother's sharing this morning that this bread is for anyone - whoever's willing to partake of this living One!!
This song is perfect for me.
He is the living bread which gives us life eternal... What a Christ we have.
I love this song! It's amazing!!!! Thank You Lord, You are our living bread!!
I love this song. I always sing this song at the meetings.
We sang this so much during truth school but we sang differently WE SANG WITH THE SPIRIT. AMEN!!! Hallelujah!
If anyone eats of this bread, he shall live forever! Amen! Lord, You are the living bread!
Amazing hymn. It's really touching. Thanks to the composer and the musicians. Thank you for your great gift. I will be using this hymn in my parish soon....
i went to the conference in Anaheim IDK when but we sang this song in English then Spanish. I didn't know what it meant but I didn't care. In any language we can Praise The Lord!!
Thank You Lord that You came down out of heaven so that we can eat of You and live forever!
You are the living bread; Christ lives in me.
Thank You, Lord for the living bread for our spirit. We shall eat and feast on Thee and be satisfied. Amen!
I love this song!!!!!!!!
Amen!
Thank You God. 感谢主
Thank You Lord You came down out of heaven! Thank You You went through a process, became small enough to eat! We want to eat You everyday!
This is so delicious. It fills my spirit with joy.
I LOVE this song! In my opinion, it is the best song ever!
Good song!
This is one of my favorite hymns, it really reminds me of SSOT (summer school of truth) and gospel camp.
What an enjoyable, refreshing song! I just heard it the first time on NYCYP. Christ is our living bread!

Я есть живой хлеб, сошедший с неба; Если кто-нибудь будет есть от этого хлеба, будет жить вовек; И хлеб (и хлеб), Который Я дам, – Это Моя плоть, Отдаваемая (отдава-…) За жизнь (за жизнь) мира. Я есть живой хлеб, сошедший с неба; Если кто-нибудь будет есть от этого хлеба, будет жить вовек.
Ja jest' zhyvoj chleb, soshedshyj s nieba, Jesli kto-nibud' budiet jest' ot etogo chleba, budet zhyt' voviek. I chleb (i chleb), Kotoryj Ja dam, - Eto Moja plot', Otdava- (otdava-)jemaja Za zhyzn', za zhyzn' mira. Ja jest' zhyvoj chleb, soshedshyj s nieba, Jesli kto-nibud' budiet jest' ot etogo chleba, budet zhyt' voviek.
Wow! What a wonderfully refreshing song. Tis so sweet to hear and enjoy Christ in and through the saints. Praise Him! Hallelujah!

This song really shows me that GOD can be everywhere. I had an experience today, it was today in my brother's birthday and my cousins were there they were all talking about how denims and like how family members saw the devil. So I went to go shower when everybody left and I was scared because I was hearing all of this and so I was praying I think like for a good 30 minutes I felt like every time I would exercise my spirit the enemy was on my shoulders and trying to pull me down. This was the first time that I was crying when I was praying. This showed me that I wasn't alone and the Lord sees that were in need He will provide. This turned me closer to the LORD.
LORD SHOW ME HOW TO CONTACT YOU EVERY DAY. HELP ME TO GAIN MORE OF YOU EACH MORNING.
This song is great!! We sang this song at the young people's conference in Mansfield. It was a great experience!!

I am the living bread (Tagalog Version)
Ako ang tinapay na buhay na bumabang galing sa langit: kung ang sinoman ay kumain ng tinapay na ito, siya'y mabubuhay magpakailan man: oo at ang tinapay na aking ibibigay ay ang aking laman, sa ikabubuhay ng sanglibutan.
Wow, this song is amazing. It isn't even in my hymn book.
Praise the Lord for this special song! هللويا مجداً للرب على هذه الترنيمة!

Ma olen elav leib mis tuli alla taevast Kui keegi sööb seda leiba, ta elab igavest' Ja see leib (ja see leib) Mis ma teile (teile) Annan, on mu liha Mis on antud (on antud) Maailma elu eest Ma olen elav leib, mis tuli alla taevast Kui keegi, sööb seda leiba, tal on elu igavest'
Hallelujah! Eating Jesus is the way!!! He is our real food!
I remember my team leader making this song up on the Hike!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I love this song! A friend taught it to me.
I like this...I will be teaching this to the congregation this Sabbath at church!

Praise the Lord!! He is the living bread. He gave Himself up for us, now we can eat His Word and have His life...I've really enjoyed this hymn watching the video of the young people singing at Stratford...May the Lord capture more young people to God's economy.
Yes that is the life bread without which no one knows the KING OF KINGS, THE LORD OF LORDS, there is no salvation. HALLELUJAH! MARANATA! AMEN!

Yo soy el pan vivo que descendió del cielo Si alguno, si alguno come de_este pan vivirá para siempre Y el pan (y el pan) que daré (que da-) -ré es Mi carne La cual Yo (la cual Yo) daré por (por la) vida del mundo

Excuse my errors in grammar and punctuation from the last comment; after so much thought, this new portuguese transcription is much better than the last one, as the lyrics stay true to the Recovery Version Bible. Louve ao Senhor! Praise the Lord!
Eu sou o pão vivo, que desceu do céu; se alguém, se alguém comer desse pão, viverá eternamente;
e o pão (e o pão) q' Eu darei (é a) Minha carne q' Eu darei (q' Eu darei) pela (pela) vida do mundo
Eu sou o pão vivo que desceu do céu; se alguém, se alguém comer desse pão, viverá eternamente.
They sang this at the Bible distribution during the Olympics - all the young people who could make it.
I miss the Poland Conference.
I enjoyed singing this so much in the Poland conference! Can't wait to go back next year.

Here's a transcription of the lyrics for John 6:51 in portuguese.
Eu sou o pão vivo, que desceu do céu; se alguém, se alguém comer deste pão, viverá para sempre;.
e o pão (e o pão). q' Eu darei (é a). Minha carne q' Eu darei (q' Eu darei). pela (pela) vida do mundo.
Eu sou o pão vivo que desceu do céu: se alguém, se alguém comer deste pão, viverá para sempre.
Hallelujah! It is a sweet hymn. May we all eat from this heavenly manna day by day. Praise the Lord for His grace and for the conference in Poland.
Beautiful work, Long Beach saints. I won't ever forget the day you guys introduced these verses to us in the Summer 2012 retreat @ San Juan Capistrano. We returned that sunday to the meeting hall.

They forgot the French art of the song!!
Je suis le pain vivant descendu du ciel, Si quelqu' un mange de ce pain, il vivra pour toujours. Et le pain que je donnerai, c'est ma chair, que je donnerai pour la vie du monde.
